description: Neo-Gothic masterpiece built 1886 in Old Quarter, near Hoan Kiem Lake. Designed to emulate Notre-Dame de Paris with twin bell towers, pointed arches, rib-vaulted ceilings, and French-produced stained glass. The cathedral serves as Hanoi's most important Catholic church and stands as striking example of French colonial religious architecture that remains active worship center today.

French-produced stained glass windows with pointed Gothic arches
